summary: Neon 0.8.3 dependency has a use-after-free vulnerability (CVE WS-2022-0133) with CVSS score 7.8. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerability was either ignored or removed from the Mend inventory.
userImpact: Users of the TypeScript SDK with neon 0.8.3 are exposed to a potential memory safety vulnerability that could be exploited locally to read/write memory.
rootCause: Neon 0.8.3's JsArrayBuffer::external and JsBuffer::external did not require T: 'static, allowing creation of externally backed buffers from types that may be freed while referenced by JavaScript.
proposedFix: Upgrade neon to version 0.10.1 or later
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or removed from inventory, indicating the dependency was addressed or is no longer used.
keyQuote: Use after free in Neon external buffers between 0.8.0 and before 0.10.1
